description: This pie chart illustrates the percentage of Americans who use journaling for mental health benefits versus those who do not.
This pie chart represents the demographic breakdown of MoodMuse users, highlighting primary users, millennials/Gen Z, and students/professionals/creatives.
This bar chart depicts the projected user growth of MoodMuse in each year starting from its initial launch.
A comprehensive bar chart displaying various projections related to mental wellness, market values, and societal statistics highlighted in the document.
This line chart illustrates the Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) trends specific to the mental wellness and mental health apps market as projected in the document.
Flowchart demonstrating the user journey from signing up to the usage of the platform's journaling and recommendation features.
This flowchart explains the business model for MoodMuse, specifically focusing on the revenue streams stemming from a freemium model, subscriptions, and data insights.

This pie chart shows the distribution of the target demographic for the AI-powered journaling platform, focusing on Millennials and Gen Z who represent 70% of users and are more inclined to use digital journaling tools for mental wellness.
This pie chart illustrates the various revenue streams for the startup, highlighting the diversity in income sources ranging from subscription models to workshops.
A comparison bar chart representing the projected growth of the mental health app market from 2021 to 2026, highlighting the market opportunity for the AI-driven journaling platform.
This bar chart shows the pricing structure for the subscription plans available in the freemium model, detailing the cost difference between basic and premium options.
A line graph illustrating the projected growth in active users from launch day up to three years, showing a clear trajectory of reaching 500,000 users by the third year.
This line chart displays the targeted churn rate reduction goals of the startup, from 10% in the initial phase down to 5% by the end of the first year.
A flowchart depicting the user journey on the AI-powered journaling platform, from signing up to engaging with mood tracking and song recommendation features.
